p: ESW is usually evaluated by the Linear Sweep Voltammetry (LSV) method in a lithium/electrolyte/inert planar electrode (Pt, Stainless steel) cell configuration. Inert working electrodes are used to avoid parasitic reactions and interfering current backgrounds ( Figure 2 and Figure 3). Typically, the current at a working electrode is measured while the potential is swept linearly vs. time from lower to higher potentials.
